articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's defence minister ruled out any ceasefire in Lebanon until Israel's goals had been met.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes hit Beirut suburbs

articles.author: Peter Hobson, Lewis Jackson
articles.description: China is putting ever-greater pressure on the Philippines to cede its sovereign rights in the South China Sea, Secretary of National Defense Gilberto Teodoro said on Tuesday after a meeting with his Australian counterpart in Canberra.
articles.title: Philippines says it's under pressure from China to cede claims in South China Sea

articles.author: William James
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said time was running out to limit a destructive rise in global temperatures.
articles.title: COP29: Pay up or face climate-led disaster for humanity, warns UN chief

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: The International Monetary Fund's Pakistan mission chief Nathan Porter on Tuesday opened unusual talks with Pakistan over a $7 billion bailout approved by its board in September, the finance ministry and sources said.
articles.title: IMF holds unusual talks with Pakistan over $7 bln bailout

articles.author: Catarina Demony, Ben Makori
articles.description: For some Nigerians and their descendants who call Britain their home, Kemi Badenoch becoming the first Black woman to lead a major British political party is a source of hope and pride.
articles.title: UK's new Conservative leader Badenoch leaves British-Nigerians divided

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev accused European leaders on Tuesday of seeking to dangerously escalate the Ukraine conflict following the re-election of former U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Russia's Medvedev says Europe is trying to escalate Ukraine conflict after Trump win

articles.author: Nelson Bocanegra
articles.description: President Gustavo Petro, Colombia's first leftist leader, promised his government would acquire 3 million hectares (7.4 million acres) of land for victims of the country's six-decade conflict, to meet the terms of a 2016 peace deal with the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC).
articles.title: Colombia makes slow progress on land rights since FARC peace deal

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Beijing is pushing Pakistan to allow its own security staff to provide protection to thousands of Chinese citizens working in the South Asian nation, during talks after a car bombing in Karachi that was seen as a major security breach, sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Beijing pushes to join security efforts for citizens in Pakistan, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's Social Democrats, Greens and conservatives have proposed Feb. 23 as a date for a new election, sources told Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Germany's SPD, Greens, conservatives propose Feb 23 for election - sources

articles.author: Praveen Menon, Renju Jose
articles.description: New Zealand on Tuesday offered a rare national apology to victims and families of hundreds of thousands of young people and vulnerable adults who were subjected to institutional physical and sexual abuse over the last 70 years.
articles.title: New Zealand offers national apology to people abused in care
